## R Markdown

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
combi_tri <-  read.csv(file = "/Users/mutecypher/Documents/Documents - Michael’s iMac/Coursera/Capstone Project/processed/combi_trigrams.csv" )
combi_tri <- combi_tri[,2:4]
combi_tri$sum <- cumsum(combi_tri$n)
ninefive <- which(combi_tri$sum > sum(combi_tri$n *0.95))
combi_tri95 <- combi_tri[1:ninefive,]
ninety <- which(combi_tri$sum > sum(combi_tri$n *0.9))
setkey(combi_tri, bigrams)
trog <- setorder(setDT(combi_tri95), bigrams, -n) [,indx :=seq_len(.N), by = bigrams] [indx <= 5 ]
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
